Package GUIElements

Class SplitHTMLDocument

java.lang.Object
GUIElements.GUIElement
GUIElements.Container
GUIElements.Pane
GUIElements.SplitHTMLDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, ScrollBarListener, SeparatorBarMoveListener
public class SplitHTMLDocument
extends Pane
implements SeparatorBarMoveListener
This class forms the inner nodes of the HTMLDocument tree. It has each time a direction (Horizontal or Vertical) and a leftPane and a rightPane. Those panes are either another SplitHTMLDocument, either a HTMLDocument.

  • Constructor Summary

    SplitHTMLDocument​(LeafPane original, Direction direction)
    Creates a new splitHTMLDocument

    Changes the active element to the HTMLDocument at the given position

    Deletes the ActiveHTMLDocument and adjust the tree so that every node has 2 childeren
    HTMLDocument getActiveHTMLDocument()
    Gets the active HTMLDocument, this class has a variable that is true if the activeELement is on the left side, if false it is on the rigth side (if none it is set to left)

    • updateRightClosestChildWidth

      public void updateRightClosestChildWidth​(int newXPos, int newWidth)
      This method makes sure that only the most rightChild changes, the absolute value of the other childs must remain the same. The rightpanel x coordinate has to change accordingly
      Specified by:
      updateRightClosestChildWidth in class Pane
      Parameters:
      newXPos - - the new x position
      newWidth - - the new width

    • getRightClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth

      public int getRightClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth()
      Calculates the position of the Seperator bar thats most in the right of the tree. If it is vertical it takes the right node, otherwise it takes the maximum of both. When the class has no seperatorBar -1 is returned
      Specified by:
      getRightClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth in class Pane

    • getLeftClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth

      public int getLeftClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth()
      Calculates the position of the Seperator bar thats most in the left of the tree. If it is vertical it takes the left node, otherwise it takes the minimum of both. When the class has no seperatorBar -1 is returned
      Specified by:
      getLeftClosestSeperatorBarPositionWidth in class Pane

    • getRightClosestSeperatorBarPositionHeight

      public int getRightClosestSeperatorBarPositionHeight()
      Calculates the position of the Seperator bar thats most in the right of the tree. If it is horizontal it takes the right node, otherwise it takes the maximum of both. When the class has no seperatorBar -1 is returned
      Specified by:
